pr_title: Add support for MongoDB datatypes: Decimal128 and ObjectId

timeline.message: Preliminary support for ObjectId and Decimal128
Initial Row and Annotation processor support
Add more missing API pieces used by the annotation processor
Add preliminary support to RealmResults batch updates and DynamicRealmObject
Add missing methods for Realm.create(Class, ObjectId)

timeline.bodyText: maybe suffix these methods with Decimale128/ObjectId to make them easy to navigate/less ambiguous
timeline.author: nhachicha

timeline.bodyText: missed throwing IllegalStateException
timeline.author: nhachicha

timeline.bodyText: formatting
timeline.author: nhachicha

timeline.bodyText: why not use Decimal123.parse instead of the BigDecimal?
timeline.author: nhachicha

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure about this comment, you added the Bson deps in the library gradle implementation 'org.mongodb:bson:3.12.0'
timeline.author: nhachicha

timeline.message: Add JNI support and update tests

- Add external BSON dependencies
- Add test for Decimal
- Enabling query based test for new types

- Adding Dynamic Realm Tests
- Adding more Decimal128 tests
- Updating some nullability tests

- Updating ObjectId tests
- Adding JSON tests

- Add support for min/max/average between query for Decimal128
- Update to latest Core

timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText:
I'm a but unsure about these tests that add the type directly. I know the API theoretically allows it but, but according to the doc, it isn't legal: https://android.googlesource.com/platform/libcore/+/f0d4a04/json/src/main/java/org/json/JSONObject.java#258
But maybe this is the reason you added the instanceof check in the annotation processor?
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: Well you could write your own parser which produces a JSONObject/array it could be useful to add directly the Bson types if you know that the underlying consumer system can consume (parse them)
replies.author: nhachicha

timeline.bodyText: Same concern as for Decimal128
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText:
see previous response

you could write your own parser which produces a JSONObject/array it could be useful to add directly the Bson types if you know that the underlying consumer system can consume (parse them)
replies.author: nhachicha

timeline.bodyText: These tests seem to be missing
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: These are covered in Decimal128Tests and ObjectIdTests respectively
replies.author: nhachicha

replies.bodyText: True, so they should just be removed from here?
replies.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: Do you really need the index here?
timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: Do we need this anymore? It seems all these properties were added to other classes?
timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: I think this approach will cause a ClassNotFoundException for non-sync builds. If by accident you try to add an unsupported type, it will try to go through all these if-statements before reaching the last else statement and then you cannot find the class for Decimal128 because it is not on the classpath.
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: As discussed, let's add the bson dependency for this PR and optimise later a mechanism to make it optional. I think the method count and size will not affect apps not using these types (because of R8 tree shaking)
replies.author: nhachicha

timeline.bodyText: Same as above
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: As discussed, let's add the bson dependency for this PR and optimise later a mechanism to make it optional. I think the method count and size will not affect apps not using these types (because of R8 tree shaking)
replies.author: nhachicha

timeline.bodyText: This looks wrong. I think this is the case for Object links not ObjectID?
timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: Pretty sure this will crash with ClassNotFound if bson is not on the classpath?
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: As discussed, let's add the bson dependency for this PR and optimise later a mechanism to make it optional. I think the method count and size will not affect apps not using these types (because of R8 tree shaking)
replies.author: nhachicha

timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: What about support for Decimal128 in Sum?
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: Good catch, this is still missing from Core
replies.author: nhachicha

replies.bodyText: Ok. No reason to hold this PR waiting for that. We can always add later.
replies.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: Fix these
timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: I think you need to apply the same pattern used here to the other places where you are referencing the bson types, since they might not be available.
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: As discussed, let's add the bson dependency for this PR and optimise later a mechanism to make it optional. I think the method count and size will not affect apps not using these types (because of R8 tree shaking)
replies.author: nhachicha

timeline.bodyText: Suggested change
timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: Is SecureRandom more random than Random?
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: According to the documentation it's more secure when used in the context of cryptography, which is the case with encryptionKey parameter of the RealmConfiguration. This is more to set the example for developers
replies.author: nhachicha

timeline.message: Merge branch 'cm/new-types' of https://github.com/realm/realm-java into cm/new-types
